subject: Productivity
title: The Toyota Production System
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Toyota Production System usable.

hook.text: Toyota had almost no money after the war. Necessity forced them to eliminate every ounce of waste.

buildup.text: Taiichi Ohno developed the Toyota Production System: just-in-time manufacturing and lean processes.

discovery.text: Parts arrived exactly when needed. Inventory costs vanished. Workers could stop the line for defects.

twist.text: Western automakers needed three times the workers to match Toyota's output. Lean thinking was that powerful.

climax.text: Lean principles spread beyond cars into software, healthcare, and startups worldwide.

punchline.text: Toyota turned scarcity into the world's best production system.

quiz.question: What is the core principle of the Toyota Production System?
options: Producing as many units as possible regardless of quality
